intro: Echium benthamii, commonly known as the bentham's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Echium benthamii is often found in desert regions and is an important component of local flora.
